Begin TR_m4_Andoth_AlmalexiaShrine_sc

; Script on Activator TR_m4_Andoth_AlmalexiaShrine.
; This is the Shrine of Almalexia's Fury in Andothren, one of the Temple pilgrimage shrines.

short questionState
short button
short doOnce

if ( OnActivate == 1 )
	Set questionState to 1
	Return
endif

if ( questionState == 0 )
	Return
endif

if ( questionState == 1 )

	if ( Player->GetItemCount "ingred_frost_salts_01" > 0 )
		MessageBox "Would you like to donate Frost Salts and ask for a blessing?" "Yes" "No"
		Set questionState to 2
		Return
	endif

	if ( Player->GetItemCount "T_IngMine_IceCrystal_01" > 0 )
		MessageBox "Would you like to donate an Ice Crystal and ask for a blessing?" "Yes" "No"
		Set questionState to 2
		Return
	endif

	MessageBox "Here Almalexia struck down upon the demon hordes of Ada'Soom Dir-Kamal with divine fury and all the splendor of stars. When her rage finally subsided, Kamal was no more."
	Set questionState to 0
	Return

endif


if ( questionState == 2 )

	Set button to GetButtonPressed

	if ( button == 1 )
		Set questionState to 0
		Return
	endif

	if ( button == 0 )

		if ( Player->GetItemCount "ingred_frost_salts_01"  > 0 )
			Player->RemoveItem "ingred_frost_salts_01" 1
			Set questionState to 3
			Return
		endif

		if ( Player->GetItemCount "T_IngMine_IceCrystal_01"  > 0 )
			Player->RemoveItem "T_IngMine_IceCrystal_01" 1
			Set questionState to 3
			Return
		endif


	endif
endif
	
if ( questionState == 3 )
	Cast "T_De_Res_AlmalexiaFury" Player
	MessageBox "The Gift of Almalexia's Divine Fury: Thank you, O Face-Snaked Queen, for teaching me how to strike down my enemies as you once struck down Ada'Soom Dir-Kamal."
	if ( doOnce == 0 )
		Journal TR_m4_TT_ShrineAlmaFury 10
		set TR_Pilgrimages to ( TR_Pilgrimages + 1 )
		set doOnce to 1
	endif
	Set questionState to 0
endif

End

Begin TR_m4_Gavros_Falas_sc

; Script on NPC TR_m4_Gavros_Falas for Andothren Temple quest
; TR_m4_TT_KitchenSupplies.

short TR_Map
short control
short controlQ
short T_Local_NPC
short NoLore

; Make Gavros put on a hat if the player paid him well.
if ( GetJournalIndex TR_m4_TT_KitchenSupplies >= 101 )
	if ( CellChanged )
		if ( controlQ == 1 )
			set controlQ to 2
			additem T_Imp_ColFur_HelmEx_01 1
			equip T_Imp_ColFur_HelmEx_01
		endif
	endif
endif

if ( TR_Map )
	return
endif

set TR_Map to 4

End

Begin TR_m4_RR_BodrumShrineScript

; Script on Activator TR_m4_RR_BodrumBattleShrine.
; This is the Shrine to the Battle of Bodrum, one of the Temple pilgrimage shrines.

short button
short questionState
short doOnce

if ( OnActivate == 1 )
	Set questionState to 1
	Return
endif

if ( questionState == 0 )
	Return
endif

if ( questionState == 1 )

	if ( Player->GetItemCount "iron spear" > 0 )
		MessageBox "Would you like to donate an iron spear and ask for a blessing?" "Yes" "No"
		Set questionState to 2
		Return
	endif

	if ( Player->GetItemCount "Iron Long Spear" > 0 )
		MessageBox "Would you like to donate an iron spear and ask for a blessing?" "Yes" "No"
		Set questionState to 2
		Return
	endif

	if ( Player->GetItemCount "TR_m3_iron spear_embedded_keep" > 0 )
		MessageBox "Would you like to donate an iron spear and ask for a blessing?" "Yes" "No"
		Set questionState to 2
		Return
	endif

	MessageBox "Here the forces led by Lord Vivec were victorious over the armies of Reman III. The raging waters of Pryai River washed away the taint of Cyrodiil, impaling them on a net of spears."
	Set questionState to 0
	Return

endif

if ( questionState == 2 )
	set button to GetButtonPressed

	if ( button == 0 )
		if ( Player->GetItemCount "iron spear" > 0 )
			Player->RemoveItem "iron spear" 1
		else
			if ( Player->GetItemCount "Iron Long Spear" > 0 )
				Player->RemoveItem "Iron Long Spear" 1
			else
				if ( Player->GetItemCount "TR_m3_iron spear_embedded_keep" > 0 )
					Player->RemoveItem "TR_m3_iron spear_embedded_keep" 1
				endif
			endif
		endif
		Cast "TR_m4_RR_BattleBodrumBlessing" Player
		MessageBox "Here the forces led by Lord Vivec were victorious over the armies of Reman III. The raging waters of Pryai River washed away the taint of Cyrodiil, impaling them on a net of spears. You are blessed with the power of those old days of glory."
		if ( doOnce == 0 )
			Journal TR_m4_TT_ShrineBodrum 10
			set TR_Pilgrimages to ( TR_Pilgrimages + 1 )
			set doOnce to 1
		endif
		Set questionState to 0
	endif

	if ( button == 1 )
		MessageBox "Here the forces led by Lord Vivec were victorious over the armies of Reman III. The raging waters of Pryai River washed away the taint of Cyrodiil, impaling them on a net of spears."
		Set questionState to 0
	endif

endif
	
End

Begin TR_m4_TT_CrateRatMeat_sc

; Script on container TR_m4_TT_CrateRatMeat for Andothren Temple quest
; TR_m4_TT_KitchenSupplies.

; This container is enabled only for the quest.

if ( GetJournalIndex TR_m4_TT_KitchenSupplies >= 100 )
	if ( GetDisabled == 0 )
		Disable
	endif
	if ( doOnce == 1 )
		set doOnce to 2
		if ( GetDeadCount TR_m4_Vonos_Arendas <= 0 )
			TR_m4_Vonos_Arendas->PositionCell 241 -131944 350 8000 "Andothren"
			TR_m4_Vonos_Arendas->AIWander 512 0 0 0

	endif
elseif ( GetJournalIndex TR_m4_TT_KitchenSupplies >= 10 )

		Enable
	endif
	if ( doOnce == 0 )
		set doOnce to 1

			TR_m4_Vonos_Arendas->PositionCell 1400 -128410 100 16200 "Andothren"
			TR_m4_Vonos_Arendas->AIWander 0 0 0 0
		endif
	endif
elseif ( GetDisabled == 0 )
	Disable
endif	

End

Begin TR_m4_TT_DonationBoxScript

; Script on container TR_m4_And_Temple_Coffer for the Andothren Temple
; questline. This script is in charge of moving some Temple NPCs as well.

short doOnce
short checkGold
;global long TR_m4_TT_And_GoldCounter

if ( OnActivate )
	Activate
	if ( checkGold == 0 )
		set checkGold to 1
	endif
	Return
endif

if ( checkGold == 1 )
	if ( MenuMode == 0 )
		set checkGold to 0
		set TR_m4_TT_And_GoldCounter to ( getitemcount gold_001 )
;		MessageBox "Gold amount %G" TR_m4_TT_And_GoldCounter
	endif
endif

if ( doOnce == 0 )
	if ( GetJournalIndex TR_m4_TT_WellnessCheck >= 30 )
		TR_m4_TT_Ravur_Othravel->PositionCell 5700 -130000 200 2500 Andothren
		TR_m4_TT_Ravur_Othravel->AIWander 0 0 0 0
		set doOnce to 1
	endif
elseif ( doOnce == 1 )
	if ( GetJournalIndex TR_m4_TT_KitchenSupplies >= 90 )
		TR_m4_TT_Ravur_Othravel->PositionCell 3940 4349 14753 15000 "Andothren, Temple"
		TR_m4_TT_Ravur_Othravel->AIWander 0, 0, 5, 0, 40, 0, 10, 0, 5, 5, 25, 5
		TR_m4_TT_Ravur_Othravel->Set controlQ to 5
		set doOnce to 2
	endif
elseif ( doOnce == 2 )
	if ( GetJournalIndex TR_m4_TT_TroublesomeOrc > 20 )
		if ( CellChanged )
			TR_m4_TT_Tevuren_Galdar->PositionCell -380 522 -255 1920 "Sinramen Monastery"
			TR_m4_TT_Tevuren_Galdar->AIWander 0 0 0 25 10 0 10 20 5 10 20 0
			set doOnce to 3
		endif
	endif
elseif ( doOnce == 3 )
	if ( GetJournalIndex TR_m4_TT_Forgiveness >= 100 )
		if ( CellChanged )
			set doOnce to 4
			SetPos X 3772.126
			SetPos Y 4014.329
			SetPos Z 14600.051
			SetAngle Z 0
		endif
	endif
elseif ( doOnce == 4 )
	if ( TR_m4_TT_AndothrenFinale )
		set doOnce to 5
		PositionCell 4852.568 3661.374 15499.300 5502 "Omaynis, Ulmon Vathri's House"
	endif
endif

End

Begin TR_m4_TT_Felani_Vathri_sc

; Script on NPC TR_m4_TT_Felani_Vathri (Ulmon's daughter)
; for Andothren Temple quest TR_m4_TT_LastWillAndTestament.

short TR_Map
short control
short controlQ
short NoLore
short T_Local_NPC
short T_Local_NoLore
long posX
long posY
long posZ

; Enable only from the quest onwards.

if ( GetJournalIndex TR_m4_TT_LastWillAndTestament < 20 )
	if ( GetDisabled == 0 )
		Disable
	endif
	Return
elseif ( GetJournalIndex TR_m4_TT_LastWillAndTestament >= 20 )
	if ( GetDisabled == 1 )
		Enable
	endif
endif

if ( control == 0 )
	if ( GetDistance player < 400 )
		set control to 1
		Say "TR\Vo\TR_DeF_Cry.mp3" "[Soft weeping.]"
	endif
endif

if ( controlQ == 1 )
	; Felani is following the player to the Temple, yet outside the Temple.
	; if ( CellChanged )
	; Commented this out, since it seems to sometimes fail to fire
	; (maybe because Felani appears in the Temple later than the
	; player?). -- arvisrend
		if ( GetPCCell "Andothren, Temple" )
			PositionCell 3592 4184 14784 14034 "Andothren, Temple"
			AIFollow player 0 0 0 0
			if ( GetDeadCount TR_m4_TT_Marja_Iannus == 0 )
				TR_m4_TT_Marja_Iannus->PositionCell 3592 4320 14784 17820 "Andothren, Temple"
				TR_m4_TT_Marja_Iannus->AIFollow TR_m4_TT_Felani_Vathri 0 0 0 0
			endif
			set controlQ to 2
		endif
	; endif
elseif ( controlQ == 2 )
	; Felani is following the player inside the Andothren Temple.
	; Don't follow the player out of the Temple!
	; if ( CellChanged )
		if ( GetPCCell "Andothren, Temple" != 1 )
			PositionCell 3592 4184 14784 14034 "Andothren, Temple"
			AIFollow player 0 0 0 0
			if ( GetDeadCount TR_m4_TT_Marja_Iannus == 0 )
				TR_m4_TT_Marja_Iannus->PositionCell 3592 4320 14784 17820 "Andothren, Temple"
				TR_m4_TT_Marja_Iannus->AIFollow TR_m4_TT_Felani_Vathri 0 0 0 0
			endif
			return
		endif
	; endif
	if ( GetPos Z < 14352 )
		if ( GetDistance TR_m4_TT_Ulmon_Dead < 800 )
			Journal TR_m4_TT_LastWillAndTestament 30
			set controlQ to 3
			set TR_m4_TT_Marja_Iannus.controlQ to 3
			AITravel 4016 4160 14016
			if ( GetDeadCount TR_m4_TT_Marja_Iannus == 0 )
				TR_m4_TT_Marja_Iannus->AITravel 4056 4256 14016
			endif
		endif
	endif
elseif ( controlQ == 3 )
	if ( GetAIPackageDone )
		set controlQ to 4
		AIWander 0 0 0 10 20 0 30 20 0 0 20 0
		Face 4148 3980
	endif
elseif ( controlQ == 5 )
	if ( GetInterior == 0 )
		if ( GetDistance player > 500 )
			;do nothing
		elseif ( GetPCCell "Andothren" )
			; move marja
			if ( GetDeadCount TR_m4_TT_Marja_Iannus == 0 )
				TR_m4_TT_Marja_Iannus->PositionCell 2498 -132190 500 0 "Andothren"
				TR_m4_TT_Marja_Iannus->AITravel 5370 -132967 74
				set TR_m4_TT_Marja_Iannus.controlQ to 5
			endif
			PositionCell 2630 -132160 500 0 "Andothren"
			Say "Vo\D\F\Flw_DF003.mp3" "Thank you."
			Journal TR_m4_TT_LastWillAndTestament 45
			AITravel 5267 -132962 72
			set controlQ to 9
			Return
			endif
		endif
	endif
elseif ( controlQ <= 7 )
	if ( controlQ >= 6 )
		if ( controlQ == 6 )
			if ( GetAIPackageDone )
				set controlQ to 7
				AIWander 0 0 0 10 20 0 30 20 0 0 20 0
			endif
		endif
		if ( CellChanged )
			set controlQ to 8
			PositionCell 3682 3960 14214 8694 "Andothren, The Dancing Cup"
			AIWander 0 0 0 10 20 0 30 20 0 0 20 0
		endif
	endif
elseif ( controlQ == 9 )
	; bounceback!
	set controlQ to 6
endif

if ( TR_Map )
	return
endif

set TR_Map to 4

End

Begin TR_m4_TT_FelaniLetter2_sc

; Script on book TR_m4_TT_FelaniLetter2 for Andothren Temple quest
; TR_m4_TT_LastWillAndTestament.

short PCSkipEquip
short doOnce
short actionFlag

if ( doOnce == 1 )
    return
endif

if ( actionFlag == 1 )
    Set doOnce to 1
	Journal TR_m4_TT_LastWillAndTestament_e 10
endif

if ( PCSkipEquip == 1 )
    Set PCSkipEquip to 0
    Set actionFlag to 1
    return
endif

if ( MenuMode )
    return
endif

if ( OnActivate )
    Set actionFlag to 1
    Activate
endif

End

Begin TR_m4_TT_Fire_sc

		Disable

	if ( GetJournalIndex TR_m4_TT_LastWillAndTestament >= 40 )
		if ( CellChanged )
			Disable
		endif
	endif
else
	if ( GetJournalIndex TR_m4_TT_LastWillAndTestament == 35 )
		Enable
	endif
endif

End

Begin TR_m4_TT_LastWillDisable_sc

		Disable
	endif
endif

End

Begin TR_m4_TT_LastWillEnable_sc

; This is a script on various items that are enabled in the last quest of
; the Andothren Temple questline. Most (all?) of them are in Ulmon
; Vathri's house.

; disable/enable items if they're not in an inventory.

short doOnce

if ( doOnce < 0 )
	Return
elseif ( doOnce > 0 )
	if ( GetDisabled == 0 )
		if ( TR_m4_TT_AndothrenFinale == 0 )
			Disable
		endif
	else
		if ( TR_m4_TT_AndothrenFinale )
			Enable
		endif
	endif
else
	if ( GetPos X == 0 )
		if ( GetPos Y == 0 )
			if ( GetPos Z == 0 )
				; in inventory, do not disable
				set doOnce to -1
				Return
			endif
		endif
	endif
	set doOnce to 1
endif

End

Begin TR_m4_TT_Nalvs_Andolin_sc

; Script on NPC TR_m4_TT_Nalvs_Andolin, the main questgiver
; of the Andothren Temple questline. This relates to various quests.

short TR_Map
short control
short controlQ
short NoLore
short T_Local_NPC
short moneyExpected
short moneySet
short moneySatisfied
float timer
short T_Local_NoLore
short noHit
short ThankIbelard ; for "Remnants of Resdayn"

if ( moneySet == 1 )
	set moneySet to ( player->GetItemCount gold_001 )
	set moneySet to ( moneySet / 10 )
	if ( moneyExpected < moneySet )
		set moneyExpected to moneySet
	endif
	set moneySet to 0
endif

if ( controlQ == 0 )
	if ( GetJournalIndex TR_m4_TT_ArmunAdventure_b >= 100 )
		if ( GetDeadCount "TR_m4_Ulmon Vathri" == 0 )
			set controlQ to 1
		else	; if player killed Ulmon, the questline ends here.
			set controlQ to -1
		endif
	elseif ( GetJournalIndex TR_m4_TT_ArmunAdventure_c >= 100 )
		if ( GetDeadCount "TR_m4_Ulmon Vathri" == 0 )
			set controlQ to 1
		else
			set controlQ to -1
		endif
	elseif ( GetJournalIndex TR_m4_TT_ArmunAdventure_d >= 100 )
		if ( GetDeadCount "TR_m4_Ulmon Vathri" == 0 )
			set controlQ to 1
		else
			set controlQ to -1
		endif
	elseif ( GetJournalIndex TR_m4_TT_ArmunAdventure_e >= 90 )
		if ( GetDeadCount "TR_m4_Ulmon Vathri" == 0 )
			set controlQ to 1
		else
			set controlQ to -1
		endif
	elseif ( GetDeadCount TR_m4_V_Ofelia > 0 )
		if ( GetDeadCount "TR_m4_Ulmon Vathri" == 0 )
			set controlQ to 1
		else
			set controlQ to -1
		endif
	elseif ( GetDeadCount TR_m4_q_mm_Bisaya > 0 )
		if ( GetDeadCount "TR_m4_Ulmon Vathri" == 0 )
			set controlQ to 1
		else
			set controlQ to -1
		endif
	endif
endif

if ( controlQ == 1 )
	set controlQ to 2
	PositionCell 4669 4483 14753 11500 "Andothren, Temple"
	AIWander 0 0 5 20 20 20 0 10 10 20 0
;	AITravel 4160 4200 14020
	"TR_m4_Ulmon Vathri"->Disable
;	TR_m4_TT_Ulmon_Dead->Enable
	TR_m4_TT_Ravur_Othravel->PositionCell 4360, 4500, 14020, 12500, "Andothren, Temple"
	TR_m4_TT_Ravur_Othravel->AIWander 0, 0, 0, 0, 40, 0, 10, 0, 5, 5, 25, 5
	TR_m4_TT_Ravur_Othravel->SetHello 0
elseif ( controlQ == 2 )
	if ( GetDistance player < 150 )
		set controlQ to 3
		ForceGreeting
	elseif ( player->GetPos Z < 14700 )
		; makes no sense, but the dialogue triggers important scripts 
		; and needs to fire before the player descends the stairs.
		; only relevant if the player recalls into the Temple below.
		set controlQ to 3
		ForceGreeting
	endif
elseif ( controlQ == 10 )
	if ( GetAIPackageDone )
		set controlQ to 11
		AIWander 0 0 5 20 20 20 0 10 10 20 0
		if ( GetDeadCount TR_m4_TT_Ravur_Othravel == 0 )
			set TR_m4_TT_Ravur_Othravel.controlQ to 21
		endif
	endif
elseif ( controlQ == 11 )
	if ( GetJournalIndex TR_m4_TT_LastWillAndTestament >= 45 )
		if ( CellChanged )
			set controlQ to 12
			TR_m4_TT_Ravur_Othravel->PositionCell 3940 4349 14753 15000 "Andothren, Temple"
			TR_m4_TT_Ravur_Othravel->AIWander 0, 0, 5, 0, 40, 0, 10, 0, 5, 5, 25, 5
			set TR_m4_TT_Ravur_Othravel.controlQ to 31
			RemoveItem common_robe_02_h 1
			AddItem TR_m4_TT_FelaniLetter2 1
			PositionCell 4645 3825 15504 16200 "Omaynis, Ulmon Vathri's House"
			AIWander 0 0 5 20 20 20 0 10 10 20 0

		endif
	endif

		set controlQ to 30
	endif
elseif ( controlQ == 31 )
	if ( player->GetPos X > 3800 )
		set controlQ to 32
		ForceGreeting
	endif
elseif ( controlQ == 34 )
	if ( MenuMode )
		Return
	endif
	set controlQ to 35
	RemoveItem common_robe_05_a 1
	AddItem expensive_robe_02 1
	Equip expensive_robe_02
	AddItem "indoril boots" 1
	Equip "indoril boots"
	AddItem "indoril left gauntlet" 1
	Equip "indoril left gauntlet"
	AddItem "indoril right gauntlet" 1
	Equip "indoril right gauntlet"
	AddItem "indoril pauldron left" 1
	Equip "indoril pauldron left"
	AddItem "indoril pauldron right" 1
	Equip "indoril pauldron right"
	set hiddenWeapon to 1
	AddItem TR_m4_TT_RavurDagger 1
	equip TR_m4_TT_RavurDagger
;	RaiseRank
	RaiseRank
	RaiseRank
	RaiseRank
	RaiseRank
	RaiseRank
	RaiseRank
	AITravel 4737 3807 15491 0
elseif ( controlQ == 35 )
	if ( GetDistance player < 100 )
		set controlQ to 36
		AIWander 0, 0, 5, 0, 40, 0, 10, 0, 5, 5, 25, 5
	elseif ( GetAIPackageDone )
		set controlQ to 36
		AIWander 0, 0, 5, 0, 40, 0, 10, 0, 5, 5, 25, 5
	endif
elseif ( controlQ == 37 )
	if ( OnDeath )
		if ( GetDeadCount TR_m4_TT_Nalvs_Andolin > 0 )
			Journal TR_m4_TT_LastWillAndTestament 200
		else
			Journal TR_m4_TT_LastWillAndTestament_c 75
		endif
	endif
endif

; auto-update Orc tracker if player didn't talk to her, and Orc visits Andothren
if ( trackOrc < 10 )
	if ( GetJournalIndex TR_m4_TT_TroublesomeOrc == 100 )
		if ( GetJournalIndex TR_m4_TT_Forgiveness >= 10 )
			ModDisposition 5
			set trackPlayerMorals to ( trackPlayerMorals + trackOrc )
			set trackOrc to 10	; teaching the Orc
		endif
	endif
endif

if ( trackAshlands == -3 )
	set trackAshlands to -10
	set trackPlayerMorals to ( trackPlayerMorals - 3 )
elseif ( trackAshlands > 0 )
	if ( trackAshlands <= 9 )
		set trackPlayerMorals to ( trackPlayerMorals + trackAshlands )
		set trackAshlands to 10
	endif
elseif ( trackAshlands < 0 )
	if ( trackAshlands >= -9 )
		set trackPlayerMorals to ( trackPlayerMorals + trackAshlands )
		set trackAshlands to 0
	endif
endif

; if trackGreedTholas is set to a low value, escalate it to trackPlayerMorals and fix it at a higher magnitude
if ( trackGreedTholas >= 10 )
elseif ( trackGreedTholas <= -10 )
elseif ( trackGreedTholas )
	set trackPlayerMorals to ( trackPlayerMorals + trackGreedTholas )
	set trackGreedTholas to ( trackGreedTholas * 10 )
endif
if ( trackGreedMels >= 10 )
elseif ( trackGreedMels <= -10 )
elseif ( trackGreedMels )
	set trackPlayerMorals to ( trackPlayerMorals + trackGreedMels )
	set trackGreedMels to ( trackGreedMels * 10 )
endif
if ( trackGreedZalan >= 10 )
elseif ( trackGreedZalan <= -10 )
elseif ( trackGreedZalan )
	set trackPlayerMorals to ( trackPlayerMorals + trackGreedZalan )
	set trackGreedZalan to ( trackGreedZalan * 10 )
endif
if ( trackGreedMilns >= 10 )
elseif ( trackGreedMilns <= -10 )
elseif ( trackGreedMilns )
	set trackPlayerMorals to ( trackPlayerMorals + trackGreedMilns )
	set trackGreedMilns to ( trackGreedMilns * 10 )
endif

; temporarily disable to prevent player from encountering her outside prior to Kitchen Supplies start
if ( GetJournalIndex TR_m4_TT_KitchenSupplies < 10 )
	if ( GetJournalIndex TR_m4_TT_WellnessCheck >= 30 )
		if ( GetInterior == 0 )
			if ( GetDisabled == 0 )
				Disable
			endif
		endif
	endif
elseif ( GetJournalIndex TR_m4_TT_KitchenSupplies < 30 )
	if ( GetDisabled == 1 )
		Enable
	endif
endif

; hidden weapon for players using weapon sheathing mods
if ( hiddenWeapon == 0 )
	if ( GetHealth < 121 )
		set hiddenWeapon to 1
		AddItem TR_m4_TT_RavurDagger 1
		equip TR_m4_TT_RavurDagger
		if ( control == 1 )
			if ( GetFight == 0 )
				SetFight 30
				SetFlee 0
			endif
		endif
	endif
endif

if ( OnDeath )
	if ( GetJournalIndex TR_m4_TT_BooksBarbarians > 0 )
		if ( GetJournalIndex TR_m4_TT_BooksBarbarians < 100 )
			Journal TR_m4_TT_BooksBarbarians 120
		endif
	endif
endif

; block activation during teleportation
if ( OnActivate )
	if ( controlQ == 2 )
		Return
	elseif ( controlQ == 3 )
		Return
	else
		Activate
	endif
endif

if ( TR_Map != 4 )
	set TR_Map to 4
	set noAttack to -1
endif

End

Begin TR_m4_TT_ShrineOlmsReflct_sc

; Script on activator TR_m4_TT_ShrineOlmsReflct, the Shrine of St. Olms' Reflection
; (an Andothren Temple pilgrimage site).

short state
short localDaysPassed
short localHour
short doOnce

if ( OnActivate == 1 )
	if ( state == 0 )
		set state to 1
		set localDaysPassed to DaysPassed
		set localHour to GameHour
	endif
	if ( state <= 1 )
		MessageBox "At the end of his days, Saint Olms meditated on this rock for a day and a night. He beheld the starry skies of Lady Almalexia, the swelling sea of Lord Sotha Sil, and all he had helped Lord Vivec build."
	else
		MessageBox "The Blessing of a Heart at Peace: As the good Saint Olms reflected on his life and service, he found himself at ease. No deed remained undone, no words left unsaid, and he went into the tomb of his Fathers without fear or remorse."
		Cast TR_m4_TT_ShrineOlmsRefl_sp player
		if ( doOnce == 0 )
			Journal TR_m4_TT_ShrineOlmsRest 10
			set TR_Pilgrimages to ( TR_Pilgrimages + 1 )
			set doOnce to 1
		endif
		set state to 0
	endif
endif

if ( state == 1 )
	if ( GetDistance player > 300 )
		set state to 0
		Return
	endif
	if ( DaysPassed == ( localDaysPassed + 1 ) )
		if ( localHour <= GameHour )
			set state to 2
		endif
	elseif ( DaysPassed > ( localDaysPassed + 1 ) )
		set state to 2
	endif
endif

End

Begin TR_m4_TT_TribunalShrine

; Script on activator TR_m4_And_Temple_Shrine, a shrine in the Andothren Temple.
; Besides the usual functions of a shrine, this handles some NPC moving for the
; Andothren Temple questline.



;Cure Common Disease [and Cure Common Disease Other] do not currently work through scripts; reported as a bug
short button
short donation
short QuestionState
short doOnce

if ( CellChanged )
	if ( doOnce == 0 )
		if ( GetJournalIndex TR_m4_TT_LastWillAndTestament == 200 )
			set doOnce to 1	;both dead, do nothing
		elseif ( GetJournalIndex TR_m4_TT_LastWillAndTestament_b > 80 )
			set doOnce to 1
			PositionCell 4272 4384 15103.7 16200 "Andothren, Temple"
;			TR_m4_And_Temple_Triolith->Disable
			TR_m4_TT_Ravur_Othravel->PositionCell 4276 4470 15120 6600 "Andothren, Temple"
			TR_m4_TT_Ravur_Othravel->AIWander 0, 0, 5, 0, 40, 0, 10, 0, 5, 5, 25, 5
		elseif ( GetJournalIndex TR_m4_TT_LastWillAndTestament_c >= 80 )
			set doOnce to 1
			TR_m4_TT_Nalvs_Andolin->PositionCell 4276 4470 15120 6600 "Andothren, Temple"
			TR_m4_TT_Nalvs_Andolin->AIWander 0 0 5 20 20 20 0 10 10 20 0
		endif
	endif
endif

if ( menumode == 1 )
	return
endif

if ( OnActivate == 0 )
	if ( QuestionState == 0 )
		Return
	endif
endif

;set donation amount
if ( player->GetPCRank "Temple" >= 2 )			;member of rank 2 or above
	Set donation to 0
elseif ( player->GetPCRank "Temple" >= 0 )		;member below rank 2
	Set donation to 5
else																;not a member
	Set donation to 35
endif

if ( Player->GetItemCount Gold_001 < donation )
	MessageBox "You do not have enough gold to make a donation." "OK"
	Return
endif

if ( QuestionState == 0 )
	MessageBox "Would you like to make a donation of %.0f and receive a blessing?" donation "Yes" "No"
	set QuestionState to 10
endif

;Ask second question 
if ( QuestionState == 10 )

	Set button to GetButtonPressed

	if ( button == 0 )
		MessageBox "What blessing do you ask for?" "Cure Disease" "Cure Blight" "Cure Poison" "Lady's Grace" "Soul of Sotha Sil" "Vivec's Mystery" "Almsivi Restoration"
		set QuestionState to 20
	elseif ( button == 1 )
		set QuestionState to 0
	endif

	Return

endif

;perform cure or give message
if ( QuestionState == 20 )
	
	Set button to GetButtonPressed

	if ( button == 0 )
		if ( Player->GetCommonDisease == 1 )
			Cast "Cure Common Disease Other" Player
			if ( donation == 35 )
				Player->RemoveItem Gold_001 35
			elseif ( donation == 5 )
				Player->RemoveItem Gold_001 5
			endif
		else
			MessageBox "You are not afflicted with a common disease." "OK"
		endif
		Set QuestionState to 0
	endif
	
	if ( button == 1 )
		if ( Player->GetBlightDisease == 1 )
			Cast "Cure Blight Disease" Player
			if ( donation == 35 )
				Player->RemoveItem Gold_001 35
			elseif ( donation == 5 )
				Player->RemoveItem Gold_001 5
			endif
		else
			MessageBox "You are not afflicted with a blight disease." "OK"
		endif
		Set QuestionState to 0
	endif

	if ( button == 2 )
		if ( Player->GetEffect sEffectPoison == 1 )				;check for poison effect on player
			Cast "Cure Poison Touch" Player
			if ( donation == 35 )
				Player->RemoveItem Gold_001 35
			elseif ( donation == 5 )
				Player->RemoveItem Gold_001 5
			endif
		else
			MessageBox "You are not poisoned." "OK"
		endif
		Set QuestionState to 0
	endif
	
	if ( button == 3 )
		Cast "Lady's Grace shrine" Player					;Fortify Endurance 5
		if ( donation == 35 )
			Player->RemoveItem Gold_001 35
		elseif ( donation == 5 )
			Player->RemoveItem Gold_001 5
		endif
		Set QuestionState to 0
	endif

	if ( button == 4 )
		Cast "Soul of Sotha Sil" Player					;Fortify Magicka 5
		if ( donation == 35 )
			Player->RemoveItem Gold_001 35
		elseif ( donation == 5 )
			Player->RemoveItem Gold_001 5
		endif
		Set QuestionState to 0
	endif


	if ( button == 5 )
		Cast "Vivec's Mystery" Player					;Fortify Luck 10
		if ( donation == 25 )
			Player->RemoveItem Gold_001 25
		elseif ( donation == 5 )
			Player->RemoveItem Gold_001 5
		endif
		Set QuestionState to 0
	endif


	if ( button == 6 )
		Cast "Almsivi Restoration" Player					;restore eight attributes
		Cast "Almsivi Restore Fighter" Player					;restore eight fighter skills
		Cast "Almsivi Restore Mage" Player					;restore eight mage skills
		Cast "Almsivi Restore Stealth" Player					;restore eight stealth skills
		Cast "Almsivi Restore Other" Player					;restore three other skills
		if ( donation == 25 )
			Player->RemoveItem Gold_001 25
		elseif ( donation == 5 )
			Player->RemoveItem Gold_001 5
		endif
		Set QuestionState to 0
	endif

endif

End

				TR_m4_TT_OrcVivec->AIWander 200, 0, 5, 0, 30, 20, 0, 30, 0, 0, 20, 20
				if ( GetDeadCount TR_m4_TT_Ravur_Othravel == 0 )
					TR_m4_TT_Ravur_Othravel->PositionCell 2855, -133744, 700, 0, "Andothren"
					TR_m4_TT_Ravur_Othravel->AIWander 0, 0, 5, 0, 40, 0, 10, 0, 5, 5, 25, 5
				endif
			endif
		endif
	endif
endif

	endif
endif

if ( currentDay != DaysPassed )

begin TR_RothRoryn_Monastery_Script

; Script on activator TR_RothRoryn_Monastery_DoorAct.

short lastHealth
short openDoor
short finishedMove

if ( MenuMode == 1 )
	return
endif

if ( finishedMove == 1 )
	if ( cellChanged )
		; Make sure the secret passage remains open, even if the
		; cell gets recycled.
		TR_RothRoryn_Monastery_Wall01->SetPos, Z, 0
		TR_RothRoryn_Monastery_Wall02->SetPos, Z, 0
	endif
	return
endif

if ( openDoor == 1 )
	TR_RothRoryn_Monastery_Wall01->MoveWorld, Y, 5
	TR_RothRoryn_Monastery_Wall02->MoveWorld, Y, 5
	if ( ( TR_RothRoryn_Monastery_Wall01->GetPos, Y ) >= 3360 )
		set openDoor to 0
		set finishedMove to 1
	endif
	return
endif

if ( GetDistance, player <= 200 )
	if ( ( player->GetHealth ) < lastHealth )
		set openDoor to 1
		PlaySound3D "Door Stone Open" 
	endif
	set lastHealth to ( player->GetHealth )
else
	set lastHealth to 0
endif

end TR_RothRoryn_Monastery_Script

name: Shrine to the Battle of Bodrum
Andothren Temple Ledger
text:
Ledger for the Andothren Temple
3E413 - 3E ...

On the date, blessed by our Lords as the 24th of Morning Star, in the year four-hundred-and-thirteen of the Third Era, Serjo Dalvus Savas, cobbler and retainer of the noble muthsera Ferone Adrano, generously donated a sum of 14 (fourteen) gold pieces to our Temple.

On the date, blessed by our Lords as the 27th of Morning Star, in the year four-hundred-and-thirteen of the Third Era, Serjo Salvi Relis, commoner of no fixed profession and residence, generously donated a sum of 2 (two) gold pieces to our Temple.

On the date, blessed by our Lords as the 1st of Sun's Dawn, in the year four-hundred-and-thirteen of the Third Era, Curate Nalvs Andolin engaged in a transaction with a traveling salesmer, buying 10 (ten) bushels of saltrice on the authority of the most honorable servant of ALMSIVI Master Muthsera Ralvos Hleran.

[The text drones on endlessly, meticulously detailing each and every transaction over the last fourteen years.]

name: Felani's Letter
text:
Father,

Thank you for reaching out. I honestly didn't expect to hear from you again, the way we argued before I left for Cyrodiil. I know I disappointed you, but I could not stay. Still, the things you said back then put a heavy burden on me, and for the longest time I blamed myself for leaving you, for building a new life, for simply being happy, while you remained in Morrowind with such bitter words said the last time I saw you. That's why your letter meant so much to me. We can't change our past choices, but we can learn to live with them, and maybe we can move on.

I am so sorry to hear about your health. You said that the Temple is helping, but the way you describe this priest that has been visiting you makes me doubt he has your best interests at heart. You are many things, but not greedy, and not evil. Surely the Gods can see that, both mine and yours.

I've talked it over with Marja, and we have decided that we are coming to Omaynis, as soon as we can. I know you are set in your ways and have no fondness for the Imperials, but I can assure you she is even more stubborn than you are, and she is determined to meet you. Give her a chance, and I'm sure you will like her.

Love, always,
Felani


P.S.
Next time you write, address your letter to Felani Iannus. I took Marja's surname, and that's how the people here know me. I know you disapprove, but if you want your letters to arrive, stop confusing the mailmen.

name: Ulmon's Unsent Letter
text:
Dear Felani,

I know I'm a stubborn old Hoom, I see that now. You were only following your heart, and I made life so much more difficult for you. Leaving me was the only sensible thing to do. Please, be careful when you traverse the mountain paths. I long to see you, and your Marja. I hope we still have time.

Yours always,
Ulmon

name: Crumpled Paper
text:
By the Grace of ALMSIVI, Lords and Rulers of All

Know all Dunmer by these words that Muthsera Ulmon Vathri has willed his possessions and house in Omaynis to the Temple--
...has bequeathed his estate to Nalvs Andolin representing the Andothren Tem--
...has bequeathed his estate to the Tribunal Temple. Master Nalvs Andolin will act as caretaker of Ulmon Vathri's estate--
...Nalvs Andolin will be appointed as caretaker of said estate until such a time--

name: Response from D.D.
text:
To the Honorable Serjo,

Insult us not with so low a tribute again.

D.D.

name: Ravur's Scrawled Note
text:
%PCName

meet me in the dormitories

do not say a word to Nalvs

URGENT

name: Ulmon Vathri's Will
text:
By the Grace of ALMSIVI, Lords and Rulers of All

Know all Dunmer by these words that Muthsera Ulmon Vathri has willed his possessions and house in Omaynis to the Temple has bequeathed his estate to the Tribunal Temple. Master Nalvs Andolin will be appointed as caretaker and sole executor of said estate until such a time that it can be liquidated to benefit the charitable mission of the Tribunal Temple in Andothren.

Signed,
Ulmon Vathri

As witnessed on behalf of the Tribunal Temple by
Master Nalvs Andolin
Temple: Andothren Charity

Ulvys Ules, the steward of Tholer Andas, said the councilor already makes regular donations to the Temple, and that I should meet with Tholer Andas directly if I wanted to solicit an additional contribution from the councilor.
Tholer Andas admonished me for entering his estate uninvited, and refused to further support the charitable mission of the Temple.
Tholer Andas agreed to support the charitable mission of the Andothren Temple. I am to collect his donation from his steward, Ulvys Ules, in the foyer.
I was given a large amount of Hlaalu Company scrip, to serve as Tholer Andas' donation to the Temple. We will see whether this satisfies Nalvs.
Nalvs seemed slightly bemused with the fact that the donation by Tholer Andas consisted of Hlaalu Company scrip, but accepted it regardless.
I told Nalvs that I had not managed to speak with Tholer Andas.
I gave Nalvs gold in equal value to the scrip that Tholer Andas donated.
Tholer Andas cannot support the charitable mission.
Temple: Andothren Charity
Tholas Horaren seems extremely paranoid. It might be hard to convince him to support the charitable cause.
I tricked Tholas Horaren into buying the cure for greed.
I gave Tholas Horaren the cure for greed, and he contributed a donation to the Temple in return.
I convinced Tholas' wife, Manse Horaren, to contribute to the charitable cause in his stead.
The Horaren donation is now with the Temple.
I told Nalvs of Tholas Horaren's suspicions and refusal to support the charitable mission.
Tholas Horaren cannot support the charitable mission.
Temple: The Last Will and Testament of Ulmon Vathri
I showed Nalvs the note Ravur gave me, and he told me to keep an eye on her.
Nalvs Andolin denies defrauding the Temple and forbade me from speaking to Ravur Othravel again.
Nalvs Andolin attacked Ravur Othravel, and killed her.
Nalvs Andolin thanked me for not helping Ravur Othravel apprehend him.
Nalvs decided to return Ulmon Vathri's inheritance to Felani, and asked that he and I never speak of the matter again.
Temple: The Last Will and Testament of Ulmon Vathri
Ravur covertly slipped me a note and ran upstairs.
The little note Ravur passed me says to meet her upstairs, but not to talk to Nalvs. I wonder what she's up to.
Ravur told me she is an undercover member of the Ordinators of Doctrine. She mistrusts Nalvs and was sent to spy on him.

Ravur outlined her suspicions of Nalvs. She thinks he is trying to rake in as many donations as possible, embezzling money, and is working towards defrauding the Temple. She suspects that he manipulated Ulmon into signing over his possessions to the Temple.
I am to find Felani and her partner at the Dancing Cup while Ravur works on a way to covertly enter Nalvs' quarters so we can search for proof of his efforts at defrauding the Temple.

Ravur gave me a Scroll of Ekash's Lock Splitter, but suggested I try to find a key to Nalvs' quarters in case there are any other locks that would require magic to bypass. The doors all use the same mechanism, so anyone with access to the storage area would have a key that unlocks Nalvs' office.
Ravur was distressed that all the contents of the Temple coffers had been removed before we searched Nalvs' office. She suggests we wait to see what Nalvs' next move is.

Nalvs Andolin has left the Andothren Temple in a hurry. Ravur thinks he is making a run for it. Perhaps he went to Ulmon Vathri's house. I am to go there and confront him. Ravur needs to collect her gear, and said she would be right behind me.
I have found Nalvs Andolin in Ulmon Vathri's house, among chests full of riches taken from the Andothren Temple.
I arrived late to Ulmon Vathri's house in Omaynis.
Nalvs Andolin attempted to convince me not to hand him over to the Ordinators.
Ravur Othravel joined me in Omaynis, and attempted to arrest Nalvs Andolin.
Nalvs Andolin attacked Ravur Othravel, and died in the ensuing fight.
Ravur told me to collect the fortune Nalvs Andolin absconded from the Temple with, and return it to her.

Ravur Othravel allowed me to keep most of the gold and riches that Nalvs had taken, on account of not being able to trace back where they came from even if she wanted to. The Temple hardly needs the extravagance, and will be able to provide services to the poor with less now that Nalvs is no longer hoarding fortune. I am to meet her in Andothren once I am ready.
All that is left now is to settle the matter of Ulmon Vathri's will.

With Nalvs Andolin's death and disgrace, Ravur Othravel will assume the position of Master of the Andothren Temple, for the time being. She thanked me for my work, and gave me her dagger as reward for my services.
Temple: The Last Will and Testament of Ulmon Vathri
I obtained a key to the Andothren Temple. It should open the door to Nalvs' office.
Temple: The Last Will and Testament of Ulmon Vathri
I found an unsent letter written by Ulmon Vathri, addressed to his daughter. She will be interested to see its contents.
The Temple coffers in Nalvs' office are empty.
Temple: Andothren Charity
Zalan does not seem eager to support the Temple.
Zalan relented, and accepted my cure for greed in exchange for a small donation.
I convinced Zalan to make a donation to support the charitable cause.
I gave Zalan's donation to Nalvs, who seemed satisfied enough.
Zalan cannot support the charitable mission.
Temple: Andothren Charity
Milns Lloran claims she has made a recent contribution to the Temple already.
I blackmailed Milns Lloran into increasing her donations to the Temple.
I convinced Milns Lloran to give us an advance on next year's contribution.
I handed Milns' donation to Nalvs Andolin.
I told Nalvs that Milns' previous donation should suffice.
Milns Lloran cannot support the charitable mission.
Temple: Andothren Charity
Mels Mathyn offered to donate to the Temple if I roughed up, or intimidated a commoner who had insulted him. I turned him down.

Mels Mathyn told me to find the drunk Dunmer that insulted him in the Dancing Cup, in the eastern part of town, and send him a message. I am to convince him to apologize to  Mels. It was suggested I use intimidation or violence to teach the commoner a lesson, but perhaps he can be reasoned with.
I convinced Velms Braven to apologize to Mels for his insults.
Ravur Othravel wanted to try to convince Mels herself. I'm not sure if she will succeed, but I agreed to leave her alone with Mels for a moment.
It seems that Mels was satisfied, and he gave me his contribution to the Temple's charitable efforts.
It seems Ravur -- somehow -- managed to convince Mels to support the charitable mission.
Mels Mathyn cannot support the charitable mission.
Temple: The Last Will and Testament of Ulmon Vathri
Nalvs Andolin told me to follow him into the Temple tombs.
Ulmon Vathri has passed away.
Ulmon's estranged daughter has come to Andothren. Nalvs Andolin is worried that she might be harboring suspicions about her father's will.

I am to go to the Dancing Cup to escort Ulmon Vathri's estranged daughter and her partner to the cremation ceremony. First, however, I should check with Ravur Othravel to see if she needs anything to prepare for their arrival.
I found Felani outside the Dancing Cup. I should escort her to the Temple tombs so Ulmon Vathri's cremation ceremony can begin.
I have escorted Felani to the Temple tomb.
The cremation ceremony should have concluded by now. I should see if Nalvs Andolin or Felani need anything of me.
I should escort Felani and her partner back to the Dancing Cup.
Felani and Marja are headed back to the Dancing Cup. I should find Ravur and see what the next step of her plan is.
It has been decided that Ulmon Vathri's house and possessions should pass to his daughter Felani. I should bring her the good news at the Dancing Cup.
While Felani was grateful, she mentioned she only wished she had reconnected with Ulmon Vathri before his death.
Ulmon Vathri's unsent letter gave Felani a large measure of closure. She and Marja are set to move to Omaynis, unburdened by the past. She gave me a small keepsake as a sign of her gratitude.
Both Ravur Othravel and Nalvs Andolin are dead.
Temple: Kitchen Supplies
I convinced Gavros Falas to sponsor the Temple kitchen for an extended period of time.

Sani Edralo, the cook in the Andothren Temple kitchen, thanked me for arranging the deliveries of high-quality supplies, and handed me a bundle of pocket change she had collected from the Temple staff as a reward.
Temple: Kitchen Supplies
I bought a crate of rat meat from a fisherman.
Temple: Andothren Charity
Nalvs Andolin told me of the moral decay in Andothren, and the difficulties of keeping the Temple's charitable work going.

I was instructed to find more patrons to support the charitable mission of the Andothren Temple among the Hlaalu nobility. They do not seem particularly eager to support the Temple, but Nalvs Andolin believes they can be coerced into renewing their donations if we offer them a cure for greed.

I should offer a cure for greed to Tholas Horaren, Milns Lloran, Zalan, Mels Mathyn, and Tholer Andas. I can pick up the potions from Gadani Pathavel in the Andothren Temple. Or alternatively I could try to convince them to support the charitable mission without resorting to trickery.
I received five potions from Gadani Pathavel, the Temple's apothecarian, who seemed very sceptical of Nalvs' plan.
Mels' donation is now with the Temple.
I am done collecting donations for the Andothren Temple from the town's Hlaalu nobility. I should ask Nalvs Andolin about further duties to perform.
Gadani Pathavel was glad I didn't squander her potions of cure disease on Nalvs' scheme, and exchanged them for a more useful set of potions.
Temple: A Troublesome Orc
Ravur Othravel gave me a book on how to treat heretics.
Temple: A Troublesome Orc
Garash told me he cannot read very well, so if he is to learn about Vivec from a book, I will have to find some sort of reading aid for the barbarian.
I have brought Garash both Saryoni's Sermons and ABCs for Barbarians, and he has asked me to give him some time to read. I should come back tomorrow and see whether he has made any progress.
It has been a day. I wonder if Garash has made any progress on reading Saryoni's Sermons.
Temple: Armun Ashlands Avenger
I have slain the cultists of Malacath in Hummurushtapi. I'm sure Nalvs Andolin would be happy to hear that.
Temple: Armun Ashlands Avenger
I have found two dead bandits northeast of Arvud. Presumably they were the ones that ambushed the pilgrim. I should report back to Nalvs Andolin.
Temple: Armun Ashlands Avenger
I killed the Ashlander chief, Vabal-Ajunta. Surely the Ashlanders had something to do with the death of a pilgrim in the Armun.
Temple: Troublesome Orc
After fighting alongside him to defeat Malacath's cultists, I invited Garash gro-Vivec, the troublesome Orc of Bodrum, to join the Temple in Andothren.
Garash gro-Vivec, the troublesome Orc of Bodrum, died in one of Malacath's shrines.
I fought and killed the troublesome Orc, Garash gro-Vivec, in one of Malacath's shrines.
The Gambling Addict
Temple: Kitchen Supplies
Nalvs Andolin tasked me with finding Ravur Othravel, who was sent to the western docks to procure supplies for the kitchen, but hasn't returned.
A fisherman in Andothren told me Ravur Othravel went to the east of town to look for better supplies for the kitchen.
I found Ravur in the eastern part of Andothren.
Ravur Othravel has been trying to procure supplies for the Temple kitchen from Gavros Falas, a merchant in western Andothren, to little avail. She asked me to try and negotiate with the trader.
I have told Ravur Othravel that I had secured supplies for the Temple kitchen, and she will return to the Temple. I should report back to Nalvs Andolin.
Nalvs Andolin thanked and reimbursed me for arranging supplies for the Temple kitchens, meager as they are.

Nalvs Andolin was not pleased that I exceeded the Temple budget arranging supplies for the Temple kitchen and refused to reimburse the cost. Even so, I have secured a good source of foodstuffs to the benefit of the community.
Temple: A Troublesome Orc
Ravur Othravel asked me to find a copy of "ABCs for Barbarians" to help educate Garash.
I brought a copy of "ABCs for Barbarians" to Ravur Othravel. She thanked me, and asked me to find the other books in the series: "Arithmetic for Barbarians" and "Geometry for Barbarians."
Ravur Othravel asked me to find copies of "Arithmetic for Barbarians" and "Geometry for Barbarians" to help educate Garash.
I brought "Arithmetic for Barbarians" to Ravur Othravel. Now all that's left to find is "Geometry for Barbarians."
I brought "Geometry for Barbarians" to Ravur Othravel. Now all that's left to find is "Arithmetic for Barbarians."
I have delivered both "Arithmetic for Barbarians" and "Geometry for Barbarians" to Ravur Othravel, and she will see to Garash' continued education.
Since Garash gro-Vivec is dead, there's no use in procuring any more books for him.
Ravur Othravel is dead, so there's no use in bringing her books to teach Garash.
Garash gro-Vivec thanked me for all I have done for him, and offered to be my traveling companion should I ever have need of him.
Temple: Pilgrimage to the Shrine of Almalexia's Fury
I made the pilgrimage to the Shrine of Almalexia's Fury and read the message inscribed there.
Temple: A Troublesome Orc
Nalvs Andolin sent me to Bodrum to deal with a troublesome Orc. Apparently the Orc has been harassing pilgrims on the roads, and for some reason the local guards refused to interfere.
Apparently there has been a misunderstanding. The troublesome Orc is, in fact, not a brigand, but an eccentric follower of Vivec.
I should talk to Garash gro-Vivec, the troublesome Orc of Bodrum, myself. Golvyn Saryon mentioned he was last seen on the bridge across the Pryai, west of Bodrum.
After an initial confrontation, Garash gro-Vivec agreed to talk to me.
Garash told me of his travels through Malahk-Bazul and his encounter with a knight in glass.
Garash has devoted himself to emulating Vivec after a devotee of Vivec saved his life.
Garash insists that I prove the strength of my own devotion to Vivec to him, before he is willing to accept my counsel.
I convinced Garash of the strength of my devotion to Vivec. Hopefully he will now let me talk to him about his desperate need for guidance.
Our battle convinced Garash of the strength of my faith, and he seems open to the idea that he is in desperate need for guidance in Temple doctrine.
I invited Garash gro-Vivec to come to the Andothren Temple.
I sent Garash gro-Vivec on a pilgrimage to Vivec city.
I encouraged Garash gro-Vivec to formally renounce Malacath at one of his shrines.
I convinced Garash gro-Vivec to worship Malacath instead.
I sent Garash gro-Vivec on an impossible mission. I doubt we will hear from him again.
Nalvs Andolin strongly disagreed with me inviting the troublesome Orc of Bodrum to Andothren.
Nalvs Andolin was not pleased that I tried to guide Garash gro-Vivec to be a proper member of the Temple.
Nalvs Andolin was not thrilled with the idea of Garash gro-Vivec renouncing Malacath, though he seems to hope that we will not see the Orc again.
Nalvs Andolin thanked me for sending the troublesome Orc of Bodrum away.
Nalvs Andolin seemed to appreciate me sending the Orc to die at Red Mountain.
Garash gro-Vivec, the troublesome Orc of Bodrum, is dead.
Nalvs Andolin thanked me for killing the troublesome Orc of Bodrum.
Temple: Pilgrimage to the Tomb of Saint Olms
I made the pilgrimage to the Tomb of Saint Olms and read the message inscribed on the shrine.
Temple: Armun Ashlands Avenger
I am to go to Arvud in the Armun Ashlands, find whoever killed a pilgrim north of the town, and bring them to justice.
The people of Arvud suspect Daedric cultists in the shrine north of town, or the ashlanders to the northeast, were responsible for the death of the pilgrim.

I spoke to an Orc at a Daedric shrine in the Armun Ashlands. He swore his people do not harm unarmed travelers, and suggested bandits may have taken up residence in the ruins to the east. Perhaps they are responsible for the death of a pilgrim.

Nalvs Andolin seemed glad that I returned from my expedition to the Armun Ashland, having made the presence of the Temple felt in the area, even if we might never be sure if we caught the pilgrim's killer.
Temple: Wellness Check
I am to visit Ulmon Vathri in Omaynis and make sure that he is well.
Ulmon Vathri wants a cure for greed. I am not sure if such a thing exists, but he seems convinced that a simple potion should suffice.
Ulmon Vathri is adamant that he needs a potion to cure him of his greed, and suggested I talk to Nalvs Andolin about it if I don't believe him.
I have given Ulmon Vathri a potion of cure common disease, and he seems satisfied. I should report back to Nalvs Andolin in Andothren.
I have convinced Ulmon Vathri that he did not need a potion to face his ancestors. He seems at peace now. I should return to Nalvs Andolin in Andothren.
Nalvs Andolin thanked me for checking on Ulmon Vathri.
Nalvs Andolin thanked me for checking on Ulmon Vathri.
Ulmon Vathri is dead.
Temple: Pilgrimage to the Shrine to the Battle of Bodrum
I made the pilgrimage to the Shrine to the Battle of Bodrum and read the message inscribed there.
Temple: Pilgrimage to the Shrine of Forgiveness
Nalvs Andolin told me to make a pilgrimage to the Shrine of Forgiveness in the Monastery of Saint Aralor.
The Shrine of Forgiveness is located in the cavern below the monastery, and can be accessed using the Penitent's Ring.
I have read the inscription on the Shrine of Forgiveness.
Nalvs Andolin demanded I make a donation to support the charitable mission of the Andothren Temple. I can leave a monetary contribution in the box on the central dais.
I donated a single septim to the Temple, and in response Nalvs expelled me from the Temple. Turns out he does not have a sense of humor.
My contribution to the Temple coffers was deemed insufficient, and Nalvs wasn't very happy with me.
I made a contribution that Nalvs deemed sufficient, and he gave me a book in return.
Nalvs Andolin was ecstatic with my contribution to the Temple, and rewarded me with a book. He seems convinced my generous donation will be multiplied manyfold by the grace of the Tribunal.

The Andothren Temple is willing to provide the remaining half of the statue funds for Indoril Beroth, in the form of scrolls and poultices of equivalent value. I should tell Indoril Beroth that the matter of payment is taken care of.
I will report all that happened here to my order, and then the Temple hierarchy will select a new master for this Temple. Until then, I will remain here to fulfill those duties.
Tevuren Galdar and I were sent here by our order specifically to investigate Nalvs Andolin.

The Order of Doctrine and Ordination ensures that Temple dogma is uniform throughout the land, and that the strict separation between the Hierographa and the Apographa is observed. We routinely inspect local Temples and monasteries to ensure that their teachings are in line with Temple canon. Simply put, we are the arbiters of theological disputes within the Tribunal Temple. Each misinterpretation we correct means one less task for the Order of Inquisition.
You did a good thing, youngster. Speak to my wife if you haven't already.
Talk to my wife Sani. She's the cook, she handles supplies.
Thanks again, %PCName.

You have my thanks. I doubt Nalvs Andolin will pay you, so I went around and asked the rest of the Temple staff here to chip in. This pocket change probably does not cover everything, but I hope it helps.

text: I will promptly arrange for deliveries of supplies. Thank you, %PCName. This arrangement will be a great boon to both my business and the people of Andothren.

I am not unsympathetic to the plight of Andothren's poor. I've hit rock bottom myself once or twice, and it's not pretty. But I'm running a business here, not a charity, and I need to consider what's in it for me. I could make a one-time donation to the Temple, but that'd help neither you nor me in the long run. text: I knew you were a merciful %PCRace, %PCRank %PCName. When Ravur gets here, prevent her from arresting me, kill her, and even if our Lords will not reward us, I will reward you myself. You can have all the riches in this here house. As long as you do not breathe a word of what transpired, and let me walk away. I'll return to the Temple, and we will pretend like nothing ever happened. That is all I ask of you.
result: Choice "Absolutely not." 10 "I'll think about it." 21

text: I can't be caught by the Ordinators. They will do terrible things to me, %PCRank %PCName. They will take my hands and my feet and burn me on a pire. But you remember the teachings of mercy of our Lady Almalexia, don't you? Surely I don't deserve whatever the Ordinators will do to me? Tell you what, you can share in these riches. After all, you too deserve to be rewarded for diligently doing your duties? Here, take this, please. An advance. And then let us discuss what you can do to help me.

text: To retire, comfortably and quietly. I would sell this house, and take these riches that I have earned and should have been given. And I would move somewhere far away. I deserve that at least, after a lifetime of devoted service. But you and Ravur have put a stop to that now. Still, that doesn't mean we need to involve the Ordinators, do we, %PCName?
result: Choice "The Order of Doctrine has been investigating you from the start, and Ravur Othravel will be right along to bring you to justice." 5

text: Betray their trust? I toiled, for decades, just to serve them, and the people of Andothren. Scraped together what we could just to feed ungrateful mouths. Like babes clinging to Lady Almalexia's teats, the poor and wretched suck us dry. But I did my duties, without complaining. And what did I get for it in return? Nothing! Our gods have abandoned us, they have retreated into their palaces, with no regard for our service. No, %PCRank, we will not be rewarded, we will need to claim our fortune ourselves.
result: Choice "And what were you planning, once you had grasped your fortune?" 4

text: Damn that Ravur Othravel. I knew that would-be-novice was no good the moment she stepped into my Temple. I thought I had shaken the Ordinators when Galdar left, but they're sneakier than people give them credit for. Fine. You caught me. But I assure you I have a good reason for doing what I did. I'm sure you will see sense, see my side of the story. You have to. I have taken nothing I haven't deserved.
result: Choice "So you admit it. Why did you betray the trust of the Tribunal?" 3

text: "ABCs for Barbarians" is quite a common find at reputable book stores. It's used throughout the Empire to teach basic literacy to those that didn't get a comprehensive education at a younger age.

The next books we'll need are "Arithmetic for Barbarians" and "Geometry for Barbarians." Like I said, I'm not sure where to find them, and they're a less common than "ABCs." But they're vital to teaching Garash the basics.
"Geometry for Barbarians" is the book we're still looking for, %PCName.
"Arithmetic for Barbarians" is the only book we're missing now.

With these books, all we need now is a little patience and perseverence, and Garash will be a true member of our Temple. I'll see to his continued education, %PCName. You've done your part, now let me do mine.

The Temple has decided to return my father's house and possessions to me? I don't know what to say. Thank you, I suppose. I only wish that me and Ulmon Vathri had had a chance to reconnect before his death. I don't quite know if I can accept this inheritance without closure.
result: Journal TR_m4_TT_LastWillAndTestament 55

text: I know I am not the beneficiary of my father's modest estate. I bear no ill will towards your Temple for it. I have no ties left to Morrowind, and my falling out with my father leaves me little desire to stay. I don't mind the Temple selling the house and the proceeds going to charity. Still, the way my father wrote about his encounters with your priest, I couldn't shake the feeling that he was being taken advantage of somehow.
I have heard that you claim to be the Incarnate. I do not know the truth of the matter, but for now I will not give you duties.
You have been expelled from the Temple.
Let's never speak of that again, please.
result: ModDisposition -10

text: Let's talk later, %PCRank. In Andothren.

I suppose I have no choice but to return Ulmon Vathri's house and possessions to Felani. We can't have her asking too many questions. Best to just let this one go. Tell her she can have the house, and her father's things. If it helps, I have a letter from her father, that he never did send to her. Give it to her, it might placate her. Then let us never speak of anything that happened here, again.

text: Perhaps I am too pessimistic. But I find the timing to be highly suspicious. If Felani learns that her father's inheritance is not going to her, but to us, who knows what she might do. I already sent word to our associates in Kragenmoor, and they managed to find Felani as she crossed into Morrowind and directed her here. She and her partner are waiting for us at the Dancing Cup. I will need you to bring them here, but check with Ravur before you go. She was to prepare for their arrival.
result: AddTopic "prepare for their arrival"

text: Morally, our Temple has no right to Ulmon Vathri's inheritance. Returning it to Felani is the least we can do to wash our hands of Nalvs Andolin's actions.

With Nalvs Andolin's death, we might never know definitively whether he manipulated Ulmon Vathri or not. Still, it would not be right for us to take his inheritance. I will see to it that Ulmon Vathri's will is declared invalid, and that his house and meager possessions go to Felani instead of our Temple. We have no need for it, regardless. I think she is still at the Dancing Cup. Go bring her the good news. That should be the end of this Temple's former Master's manipulations. As for Nalvs Andolin...

text: I think Nalvs either coerced or tricked Ulmon Vathri into willing his estate to the Temple, and plans to take personal advantage of it. If there is anything to find, he will have it locked away in his personal quarters. I will work on a way to enter his quarters, while you go and escort Felani to the Temple.

text: Like I said, go to Arvud, find whoever is most likely to have killed that pilgrim, and smite them in the name of our Lords. And before you ask, no, this is not a job for the Ordinators. We don't need the Alma Rula interfering in our affairs here in Andothren. What we need is to find ourselves a culprit, and show that the Ashlands are not beyond the reach of the Tribunal's justice.

A pilgrim who was on their way to Andothren from down south was found dead in the Armun Ashlands, just north of Arvud. The ashlands are dangerous, and pilgrims usually avoid them. The body was found mutilated and stripped of valuables, which suggests bandits or worse killed them. We can't have that, and I can't have the Ordinators breathing down my neck about it. Go to Arvud, find out what happened, and show that the Temple does not tolerate assaults on pilgrims.

We know better than to risk the wrath of the settled peoples, outlander. Whoever killed your pilgrim was not Tirigan. But these lands are full of dangers. There are Orcs in the Daedric shrine to the west, and bandits in the ruins to the east. Mabrigash prey on the unwary, and during ash storms and at night, worse things still come out to prowl these wastes. Any one of those could have killed a traveler. But not us.

text: Absolutely not. Out of the question. You were to procure simple supplies for the Temple kitchens, not negotiate some deal with a merchant in extravagant delicacies. I will not reimburse you a single drake.
Nalvs Andolin says it's the stuff of foreigners, with their strange gods and strange ways. Better to leave it all to the Temple, he says.
I was ambushed in Malahk-Bazul and saved by a knight in glass armor.

I was a faithless and fatherless sellsword, living a life without purpose but the thrill of battle. Everything changed when I was hired to escort a caravan through Malahk-Bazul. We were ambushed by a tribe of savages, and my traveling companions were cut down one by one. Finally I was overwhelmed too, struck down and bleeding, and I was sure that was the end of me. I would have died, if not for the arrival of a knight in glass.
result: AddTopic "knight in glass"

text: Not yet.

It's a village to the west, near the river. I typically take the silt strider there, but if you want to travel on foot, take the road north to Teyn and continue on west towards Kartur from there. Oh, and if you run into Nevusa Lladri, best leave her to her work there. She's running an unrelated errand for me.

text: It's an egg town. My brother works in the Kwama egg mine there.

text: Before I give you any other duties, you should prove your faith by making three pilgrimages. I can offer you pilgrimages, as can any other Master of the Temple. It does not matter whether all your pilgrimages are done for one Master, or whether you visit several, just that you perform three. Once those three are completed, you may go to any Master and ask for duties, or further pilgrimages.

You have done more than enough for our Temple here in Andothren, serjo %PCName. If you wish to be of further service to the Tribunal, seek out Lloris Dalan in Almas Thirr, or the Temple Masters on Vvardenfell.
We need to see to Ulmon Vathri's cremation ceremony.
Follow me to the tombs, %PCRank.
As I said, there is an urgent matter at hand, %PCRank. In fact, it's best I showed you. Follow me to the tombs.

text: Tell me whether you avenged the death of a pilgrim in the Armun. Then we will discuss the important duties we are faced with now.
You were told to avenge the death of a pilgrim near Arvud.
I need you to avenge the death of a pilgrim in the Armun Ashlands.

We need the Hlaalu nobility to support the charitable mission of our Temple. Remember to offer them the cure for greed, that will surely sway them. Have you spoken to Tholas Horaren, Milns Lloran, Zalan, Mels Mathyn, and Tholer Andas?
I need to warn you of the moral decay in Andothren. We are doing what we can to keep the populace on the straight and narrow, but I fear we are losing the fight.

I do not have any more duties for you at this time, %PCRank. Speak to me again when you have achieved the rank of Adept. Until then, seek out Lloris Dalan in Almas Thirr, or the Temple Masters on Vvardenfell.
It is time to emulate Saint Aralor and shed your worldly possessions, %PCRank.
I need you to make a pilgrimage to the Shrine of Forgiveness.
You were told to solve the situation with the troublesome Orc in Bodrum, %PCRank.
You were told to solve the situation with the troublesome Orc in Bodrum, %PCRank.
There has been word of a troublesome Orc in Bodrum. I cannot spare anyone else, so you will need to look into the situation.
So, have you found Ravur Othravel? I swear, students are nothing but trouble.
I need you to find Ravur Othravel.
I told you to check on Ulmon Vathri. Have you done so?
I need someone to perform a wellness check on Ulmon Vathri.

text: I have no more duties for you, %PCRank. Seek out Lloris Dalan in Almas Thirr, or the Temple Masters on Vvardenfell.
The Office of Intercession has no further duties for you at the moment.

As I said, I'm trying to get to the local shrine of St. Seryn. I have encountered a number of alit already and would pay you to escort me, if you have time, %PCRace. The shrine is southeast of here, just west of a daedric ruin that is on a high hill. According to the people of Llothanis I need to follow the road until it passes a farm and then head south along the path to the daedric shrine. The shrine to St. Seryn is down a hill on the west side of this path. Will you aid me?

text: I'll be on the lookout. You go find us anything that will prove what Nalvs is up to. His quarters are to the right at the end of the hallway. Bring me anything you think is suspicious.

I've got this single scroll that will get you past any lock, but we might be better off finding a key to Nalvs' office. Who knows if there are any other locks behind his door that we will need to bypass. The doors in this Temple all use the same locking mechanism, so anyone who has access to the storage area will have a key that also opens Nalvs' door. In any case, you go look for proof, and I will keep a look out and make sure Nalvs doesn't catch you rummaging through his office.

text: I know little of him, save that he is an outlander who has made it quite far within House Hlaalu, and that he lives in the southwest of town. If he wants to be part of Dunmer society, he better start paying his respects, and his dues, to the Tribunal.
I'm happy to hear he is willing to contribute to the cause.
It's a shame you couldn't convince him to contribute to our cause without resorting to that cure for greed trickery.

I hear it's not uncommon for outlanders to rise through the ranks of House Hlaalu. Moreso than the other houses, anyway. If he's sensible, Zalan will be receptive to making a contribution if only to cement his reputation in the city. If you manage to make a good impression, anyway.
